metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: The opacity property specifies the opacity/transparency of an element.
content.html: The opacity property specifies the opacity/transparency of an element.

content.text: The opacity property can take a value from 0.0 - 1.0. The lower the value, the more transparent:
content.html: The opacity property can take a value from 0.0 - 1.0. The lower the value, the more transparent:
opacity 0.2
opacity 0.5

opacity 1
(default)

content.code_html:
img {
  opacity: 0.5;
}

content.text: The opacity property is often used together with the :hover selector to change the opacity on mouse-over:
content.html: The opacity property is often used together with the :hover selector to change the opacity on mouse-over:

content.code_html:
img {
  opacity: 0.5;
}

img:hover {
  opacity: 1.0;
}

content.text: The first CSS block is similar to the code in Example 1. In addition, we have added what should happen when a user hovers over one of the images. In this case we want the image to NOT be transparent when the user hovers over it. The CSS for this is opacity:1; .
content.html: The first CSS block is similar to the code in Example 1. In addition, we have added what should happen when a user hovers over one of the images. In this case we want the image to NOT be transparent when the user hovers over it. The CSS for this is opacity:1;.

content.text: When the mouse pointer moves away from the image, the image will be transparent again.
content.html: When the mouse pointer moves away from the image, the image will be transparent again.

content.text: An example of reversed hover effect:
content.html: An example of reversed hover effect:

content.code_html:
img:hover {
  opacity: 0.5;
}

content.text: When using the opacity property to add transparency to the background of an element, all of its child elements inherit the same transparency. This can make the text inside a fully transparent element hard to read:
content.html: When using the opacity property to add transparency to the background of an element, all of its child elements inherit the same transparency. This can make the text inside a fully transparent element hard to read:
opacity 1
opacity 0.6
opacity 0.3
opacity 0.1

content.code_html:
div {
  opacity: 0.3;
}

content.text: If you do not want to apply opacity to child elements, like in our example above, use RGBA color values. The following example sets the opacity for the background color and not the text:
content.html: If you do not want to apply opacity to child elements, like in our example above, use RGBA color values. The following example sets the opacity for the background color and not the text:
100% opacity
60% opacity
30% opacity
10% opacity

content.text: You learned from our CSS Colors Chapter , that you can use RGB as a color value. In addition to RGB, you can use an RGB color value with an alpha channel (RGBA) - which specifies the opacity for a color.
content.html: You learned from our CSS Colors Chapter, that you can use RGB as a color value. In addition to RGB, you can use an RGB color value with an alpha channel (RGBA) - which specifies the opacity for a color.

content.text: An RGBA color value is specified with: rgba(red, green, blue, alpha ). The alpha parameter is a number between 0.0 (fully transparent) and 1.0 (fully opaque).
content.html: An RGBA color value is specified with: rgba(red, green, blue, alpha). The alpha parameter is a number between 0.0 (fully transparent) and 1.0 (fully opaque).

content.text: Tip: You will learn more about RGBA Colors in our CSS Colors Chapter .
content.html: Tip: You will learn more about RGBA Colors in our CSS Colors Chapter.

syntaxHighlighting.text:
div {  background: rgba(76, 175, 80, 0.3) /* Green background with 30% 
opacity */}

opacity */

content.text: This is some text that is placed in the transparent box.
content.html: This is some text that is placed in the transparent box.

syntaxHighlighting.text:
background: url(klematis.jpg) repeat;
    border: 2px solid black;

content.code: This is some text that is placed in the transparent box.

syntax_highlighting.text:
background: url(klematis.jpg) repeat;
    border: 2px solid black;

content.code_html:
<html>
<head>
<style>
div.background {
  background: url(klematis.jpg) repeat;
  border: 2px solid black;
}

div.transbox {
  margin: 30px;
  background-color: #ffffff;
  border: 1px solid black;
  opacity: 0.6;
}

div.transbox p {
  margin: 5%;
  font-weight: bold;
  color: #000000;
}
</style>
</head>
<body>

<div class="background">
  <div class="transbox">
    <p>This is some text that is placed in the transparent box.</p>
  </div>
</div>

</body>
</html>

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
background: url(klematis.jpg) repeat;
    border: 2px solid black;

content.text: First, we create a <div> element (class="background") with a background image, and a border.
content.html: First, we create a <div> element (class="background") with a background image, and a border.

content.text: Then we create another <div> (class="transbox") inside the first <div>.
content.html: Then we create another <div> (class="transbox") inside the first <div>.

content.text: The <div class="transbox"> have a background color, and a border - the div is transparent.
content.html: The <div class="transbox"> have a background color, and a border - the div is transparent.

content.text:
Inside the transparent
, we add some text inside a

element.
content.html: Inside the transparent <div>, we add some text inside a <p> element.

content.html: What does the opacity property control?

Property Description
opacity Sets the opacity level for an element
